suggestions.title: Random Number Generation Using Probability Distributions
suggestions.summary: An overview of techniques for generating random numbers that follow specific probability distributions, which is the foundation for any statistical simulation.

suggestions.title: Sampling from Populations or Theoretical Distributions
suggestions.summary: Discussion of methods to draw samples either from real-world data populations or from mathematically defined distributions, enabling realistic simulation scenarios.

suggestions.title: Repeated Trials to Approximate Expected Values
suggestions.summary: Explanation of how performing many independent simulation runs allows the approximation of expected values and other statistical moments.

suggestions.title: Using Simulation Outcomes for Inference and Prediction
suggestions.summary: How results obtained from simulated data can be employed to make statistical inferences, test hypotheses, and generate predictions for future observations.
suggestions.supporting_quote: "Using simulation outcomes for inference and prediction"

suggestions.title: Monte Carlo Simulation as Repeated Random Sampling
suggestions.summary: A deeper look at Monte Carlo methods, emphasizing the role of repeated random sampling in estimating numerical quantities that are analytically intractable.
suggestions.supporting_quote: "Monte Carlo simulation is based on repeated random sampling to estimate numerical quantities."
